review_blob: Pours anice deep copper to light brown with a wonderful rich creamy head and lovely "beer" aroma. Very thick and luxurious it has alot of sweet malt flavors of dried spice and apricot some rasin and currant good dry finish with a nice hop profile to balance. This beer is very nice, reembles a belgian strong or without the metallic or fruity gum flavors but more of a traditional ale flavor that resemnbles a English brown. A must try .

This is a good session beer. Nice light flavors and aromas. Citrusy hops and a lightly sweet body make it good enjoyable to the hardcore ale drinker and yet its subtle enough for those occasionale beer drinkers. Not super terrific but OK.

This is  a very average beer. Its nothing special but its got a nice drinkable quality to it. The color is a nice light copper the hops have a nice fresh citrusy aroma the malt profile seems to be a basic carapils or light crystal malt on top of a the base this is a good beer to have around if you want something everyone can drink. I was hopinc that the name lent itself more to the hops than mountains, but the hops in this beer are very subtle and understated.

This is a really good brew. The rich malty aroma was evident from the time I opened the bottle. Strong biscuit and pale malt character dominate the sroma and flavor. It pours a dark copper to light brown color with a nice tan head and good lacing. The hop aroma is pleasant but slightly understated. This is beer is sweet and rich with a decent hop presence to balance it out. Another good effort from Moylans.

This beer pours a muddy brown, it has big malty flavor. Nice aroma of biscuity toasty bread. Hop flavor is alittle one dimentional but still very good. Pretty well balanced with earthy woody hops and sweet malt. Drinkable not my favorite esb but a noble attempt with  big flavors .

This is a good representation of a classic IPA. Pours copper with a nice head solid aroma of traditional English hops. Nice sweet malt balance finishes with a good hop bite. Flavors of pine and earth, carrot and bark. Well balanced this beer good.

This beer satrts wonderfully, nice red color good head nice hop aroma. Then it becomes less impressive. The body is a little thin and the hops never seem to reveal themselves in the flavor department. It comes across as big and bold in aroma and color but then its a little thin in body and flavor. Its not a bad thing I guess one could say this is probably what the original killians probably tasted like before they turned into a lager. I would suggest this beer to some one who has a fear of the bottom fermented as it has a nice aroma and color but is light and subtle on the tongue.
beer_name: Rogue Dry Hopped St. Rogue Red Ale

review_blob: This is agood beer it has a nice warm malty presence nutty aromas and fruity undertones. I t resembles a hearty brown ale with some decent hop flavors and aromas. The hops seem to be more of a spicy earthy english nature and balance the malt well. All in all I consider this a good Hiolliday Ale and it falls nicely into that catagorie.  Warm nutty rich and malty well balanced.

This beer was not my favorite, I have come to expect the best from Rogue. I dont know if it was the style or the beer itself that I wasnt to keen on. It pours a yellow color not much hop aroma not much malt lavor taste is a bit soapy with a strange little twang I can only assume is from the juniper.  Dry and crisp, there is a curious little numbness that occurs around the inside of the mouth starts mostly in the cheeks and travels slightly throughout, I guess it must be due to the juniper, resembling slightly the astringent character of a dry gin. I would reccomend trying this beer as it is different but more just to try probably wouldnt have it again.

This is a nice beer with a rich yet subtle malt profile focused mostly on the bready and biscuity flavors traditionally associated with an ESB. Good hops, well balanced nice woody and earthy aromas followed by a nice spicy flavor that fits well into this classic English style.

I really like this beer it pours a nice light brown with a good tan head. Nice hop aromas combine with  biscuity malt . Drinks super smooth nice bite that is well balanced with the malt sweetness and good body. Very good hop flavors and aromas. I would recommend this beer to anyone who loves Ale.

Pours a nice copper color nice hop aromas and malt sweetness. Tastes nice and sweet with a good hop bite for balance. Hop flavors are grassy and some citrus. This is a solid brew that hits the the IPA mark on the head. One comment , I prefer the more citrus and floral hops from the western USA. This beer seems to have been crafted from more traditional English hop varieties.

Bought 2 one to age and one to try now. Definitely an interesting brew. Deep gold in color nice aroma of fruity malt dried apricot nice malt aroma. Tastes resemble a well crafted belgian ale but with a stronger hop profile than a typical Belgian, Citrus annd fresh grass on the hop aroma not much bite Awaiting maturation for final review.
beer_name: Stone 20th Anniversary Encore Series: 08.08.08 Vertical Epic Ale

review_blob: Nice beer not quite as good as the original in my opinion. I believe they went mellow on the hops and malt in order to better showcase the oak. All in all a good beer but I would prefer to drink the Original.

I wasnt crazy about this beer. Its described as Czech in style but it really lacks in the hop department there is also a lack of crispness which was disapointing. NB should probably stick to the belgian influenced Ales because this was little better than an allmalt version of an American Light Lager.

This beer is nice. Its a light crisp well balanced Ale that has a really nice floral and citrus aroma. The malt profile is sweet and balances really well A nice example of the Crystal hop which is a slightly more floral lighter version of cascade.

I think this beer is an homage to the Optimator, Its good but not quite as tasty as the original. Good dark flavors of roast and chocolate nice texture perhaps a little crisper than the Spaten , but overall a nice beer.
Great beer rich malt flavor dark and full bodied really nice texture rich and thick chocolate tones and nutty biscuity roastyness.

This beer rocks Its yellow to pour and has a fresh hop aroma thats a cross between the trditional european pilsner and an american pale ale. It has a sweet malty flavor thats fruity and very tasty an awesome beer.

What can you say about the dead guy? This is an outstanding beer with a wonderful array of malt flavors and aromas complimented with a gentle hoppiness. The munich and caramel malts lend a rich biscuit and caramel flavor that represents the german Bock style very well, a definite go to.

This is a great beer pours a nice golden color hop aroma abounds rich malt sweetness cuts through the bitterness well, or vice versa well crafted packs a punch. A nice beer to try if you desire to unterstand the character of the noble german hops hallertau.

This is a wonderful beer. It has a light citrusy hop profile that is perfectly balanced with the subtle malt characteristics.  Pours a lovely copper red nice head light body . Its a lovely example of  the understated in a world of big IPAs its a nice change of pace.

Love the pale 31 but this beer just didnt do that much for me. It has some nice malt flavors and aromas but not much hop character. It may also be the oak flavor that turns me off abit, probably because most of the other oak barrel beers I have tried are higher in gravity like arrogant bastard oak.
Great beer really good aromas of Lemon and Orange fresh and wonderfull good stuff.

Pours a dark amber with a thick tan head Nice fresh hop aroma good malt sweetness nicely balanced good strong hop bite on the finish cascade presence abundant not a great variety of flavors but well balanced and strong in the representation of the style good stuff.

Pours a pretty Orange colornice hop aroma of citrus and floral orange and honeysuckle a thin white head 
excellent depth of hop flavors and aromas surprisingly good beer malt is a basic pale malt style but very good beer

Pours brownish red with a nice tan head nice color good solid hop aroma floral and citrus nice malt character chocolate and sweet great balance great flavor Scotch ale on hop steroids
not as malty as Kilt Lifter but much hoppier possibly a new favorite.

Pours a dingy copper tan head nice hop aroma , nice malt and hop balance, a lot like the original SNPA except a little more caramel flavor and an unfiltered hop appearance a little more hop aroma from fresh hops possibly wet hopped and definitely hopbacked so a hoppier slightly more caramel version of the standard.

Pours deep copper nice tan head nice citrus hop aroma possibly crystal hops, Flavor is thinbut nice bite a little lacking in depth, not really all that hoppy considering the name no real depth of flavors knida bland nothing really special except excellent lacing.

Pours a nice light copper-gold color nice white head. smells of cascade thin crisp flavor slight hop bitterness similar to Mirror Pond. This is a good beer a basic California Pale Ale smooth well balanced. A good representation of the style a little light on flavor for me but a good beer for sessioning.

Pours abit of a dark copper nice aroma fruity with big apricot tones. Flavor is nice has the obligatory delirium metallic thing going on. Nice sweetness good body crisp carbonation and eep tones of dried fruit fig and apricot.

Pours a nice dark copper color. Good fresh hop aroma not overwhelming. Huge tan head nice lacing , good caramel malt flavor good balance , not as hoppy as the southern hemi but a well balanced fresh hop flavored ale. The thing that I love about this type of beer is the depth of different hop aromas and flavors.
beer_name: Sierra Nevada Harvest Wet Hop IPA - Northern Hemisphere

review_blob: Pours dark gold nice malt aroma but no real hop aroma to speak of. This is a very basic beer some nice malty flavors of read and biscuit small hop flavor very traditional must be english hops because of the spice flavor but no real citrus or pine might be german hops perhaps. Not a bad beer just not the big boldly hopped complex malt beers that I know and love from Moylans, Still smooth and drinkable but not preferred.

Moylans always seem have a slight chocolate aroma to me maybe toffee. This beer Smells terriffic heavy on malty aromasand sweet. Pours orange copper with a nice off white head. Sweet malt with a nice bitter finish floral hops perfectly balance the sweet malty flavor. Moylans has a way of hopping their beer so the bite of hops finishes after the malt which gives each sip layers of flavor which I love. Moylans is one of my favorite brewerys and this is no exception, I look foward to trying more.

This is one of Sam Adams best efforts. Pours a nice Orange color with a thick toffee aroma flavors of caramel toffee faint chocolate makes this beer delicious and a good representation of the VMO style. The hops are present enough to balance the full  malt flavor. This beer is a good change of pace from the hop heavy IPAs I tend to frequent.

Pours a dark copper with nice tan head light hop aroma crisp clean and traditional english ale you can taste the water which adds to teh authenticity of the style a little boring for my taste but someone who is a fan of traditional english ale would really like this.

pours a nice brown tan head rich sweet malt character prune dates and other dried fruit flavors aswell as chocolate nice palate good aroma. I lean more toward the hophead pale ales but do enjoy the change of pace a nice belgian dubble or abbey provides and this one does the trick great flavors and aromas warms the soul good stuff. Doesnt hurt that it supports a cause.

Pours acopper orange with a tan headaroma of cascade and full malt nicely balanced slight bitterness on the tongue almost no real hop bite more like a copper ale than a pale in that regard good beer but not as strong in the flavor department as I prefer, possibly the lack ABV% results in less hop flavor to maintain the superior balance.

Pours adeep copper to amber color has an unfiltered appearance thick tan head strong alcohol burn sweet malt flavor good hop bitterness not as much aroma as BIgfoot still nice fruity malty aromas and flavors a little light on the bite chocolate flavors emerge upon warming, good solid malt lacks depth in the hops but still a good barley wine.

Pours a nice colden to copper color with an offwhite head great fresh hop aroma piney grassy not as much cascade as one might suspect more in the spirit of the english hop varieties only complaint is alack of malt charecter could be because I drank this following a old gaurdian barley wine. Awesome aroma less hop flavor than Deschuttes HopHenge but still really good.

This is a great beer pours copper color great head retention delicious hop aroma. I drank this right after stone ruination and the hop flavor on this was superior. Great malt charecter truly delicious hop particles were present floating throughout. Awesome beer A must try Bear Republic quickly becoming a favorite brewery of mine.
I\ pours a cloudy straw color aroma of  wheat and corriander nice citrus peel taste  good beer for the style not as pungent on the corriander as I like but still a solid witbier

I dont get it. The commercial on TV says they used cascade hops. Barely if at all, they did however use some crystal malt as is evident in the color and aroma. It pours a realy nice copper color, decent off white head, looks OK. Taste like someone mixed a Budweiser with a Boston Lager and maybe a splash of SNPA. No hop character except whatever they put in regular bud. Way to thin and carbonated, I doubt this beer was even really top fermented. Its pretty much like they took a bud and colored it to look like a pale ale, threw on a pry off cap and are hoping to sucker a few people into trying it out. I actually consider this beer to be offensive. The Michelobe craft beer efforts are at least legit. This is a bad joke!

This wasnt as bad as I thought it would be, I work as a bartender here in Las Vegas and we had an event sponsored by Bud so I checked it out just to satisfy my curiosity. If it were a hot day and I was pool side I could se myself downing a few of these for refreshment. I wouldnt say it was anything other than what it is, low calorie lime flavored water down beer for college kids to pound on spring break.

This beer is very similar  to the tremmens only its a little darker and sweeter. It has a nice copper color and a thin white head. the flavor is a nice crisp sweet tofee and dried fruit with a curious tang of sourness. This tang is understated but lendsa nice balance to the mild sweetness. A good example of balance. I like it better than the tremmens.

Wow is this chocolatey or what? This beer pours black with a brown head. The aroma is of chocolate and coffee. The taste is chocolate and coffee I wont lie its alittle bit like drinking a mocha esspresso. Nice sweet malty flavor definitely improves as temperature raises. I like it its good, but I would reccomend splitting it with a friend because it is extremely rich and sweet. 22oz btl cost me $13 so its not cheap, but nice maybe for desert with some friends.

This is a nice dark lager its a good example of the style its full mof flavor but it still has a nice crispness to it. It is similar in taste and appearance to Becks Dark. I often think the rye malt gives it a bite that reminds me a little of worcestershire sauce. Baltikas best.
Basic good to quench the thirst better than Heineken, but not much. I think this is Russias version of heineken or carlsberg its a typical representation of the style.

Its avery basic wheat beer. I usually prefer my wheat ales to be spiced in someway preferably corriander, lemon zest. Leinys sunset wheat comes to mind. This is just basic wheat malt and hops. Not offensive just nothing to speak of.
Its your basic Lager beer nothing really much to mention here actually a little thin for me.
